Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that demonstrators erected a cross at the Capitol, when in fact the cross was erected at the Michigan Capitol in Lansing.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that a cross was erected at the Capitol.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by not specifying which "Capitol" it is referring to, leading to confusion and potential misinterpretation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim could have an alternative explanation as it is possible that the cross was raised as a part of a different protest or rally, unrelated to the events at the U.S. Capitol on January 6th.
